TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SignInResponseMessage extends System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage

Docs.summary: Represents a WS-Federation Sign-In Response message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This message is created when the action parameter (wa) of the received message is "wsignin1.0" and the message contains a wresult or a wresultptr parameter.
When converting a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse> object to a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage> object, the context attribute on the RequestSecurityTokenResponse message is not transferred over, and must be explicitly set.
[!INCLUDE[wif_wsfed_ref](~/includes/wif-wsfed-ref-md.md)]
For more information about the message that this class represents, see the WS-Federation specification.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri baseUrl, string result) cil managed

Docs.param: The base URL to which the Sign-In Response message applies.
The wresult parameter in the message.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified base URL and wresult parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri baseUrl, class System.Uri resultPtr) cil managed

Docs.param: The base URL to which the Sign-In Response message applies.
The wresultptr parameter in the message.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class using the specified base URL and wresultptr parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public SignInResponseMessage (Uri baseUrl, System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse response, System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer federationSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext context);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri baseUrl, class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse response, class System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer federationSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The base URL to which the sign-in response message applies.
The to use to serialize the response.
The that contains the context for the serialization.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified base URL, response message object, federation serializer, and serialization context.
Gets or sets the wresult parameter of the message.
Docs.value: The value of the wresult parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wresult parameter from the message. Either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.Result%2A> property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.ResultPtr%2A> property must be set for the message to be valid.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the wresultptr parameter of the message.
Docs.value: The value of the wresultptr parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wresultptr parameter from the message. Either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.Result%2A> property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.ResultPtr%2A> property must be set for the message to be valid.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set a value that is not a valid, absolute URI occurs. Can be or empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Validate() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks Checks that the action parameter (wa) is "wsignin1.0" and that either the wresult parameter or the wresultptr parameter is specified.

Docs.exception:
Neither the wresult parameter nor the wresultptr parameter is specified
-or-
Both the wresult parameter and the wresultptr parameter are specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Write(class System.IO.TextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The text writer to which to write the message.
Docs.summary: Writes this message in a form post format to the specified text writer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage.Validate%2A> method before writing the message.
